_category.title: Aggregates
_category.description: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX, GROUP BY, HAVING

agg-1.title: Basic aggregation
agg-1.sql:
SELECT
  COUNT(*) as total_products,
  AVG(unit_price) as avg_price,
  MIN(unit_price) as min_price,
  MAX(unit_price) as max_price
FROM products;

agg-2.title: GROUP BY with COUNT
agg-2.sql:
SELECT
  c.category_name,
  COUNT(p.product_id) as product_count,
  AVG(p.unit_price) as avg_price
FROM categories c
INNER JOIN products p ON c.category_id = p.category_id
GROUP BY c.category_name
ORDER BY product_count DESC;
agg-2.description: Count and average price of products by category

agg-3.title: HAVING clause
agg-3.sql:
SELECT
  c.category_name,
  COUNT(p.product_id) as product_count
FROM categories c
LEFT JOIN products p ON c.category_id = p.category_id
GROUP BY c.category_name
HAVING COUNT(p.product_id) >= 2
ORDER BY product_count DESC;
agg-3.description: Filter aggregated results - categories with 2+ products

agg-4.title: Multiple grouping columns
agg-4.sql:
SELECT
  department,
  title,
  COUNT(*) as employee_count,
  AVG(salary) as avg_salary
FROM employees
GROUP BY department, title
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
ORDER BY department, avg_salary DESC;
agg-4.description: Group by department and title with salary aggregates
